utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my God, ice cream? Are you trying to kill me?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: At least you’ll die happy. Kate?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no, thanks. I couldn’t Not after this amazing meal that you guys just stuffed us with.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Oh, darling, I’m sorry, dessert is not optional. Not after I traipsed all over town to find Richard his flavor of ice cream.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Potato chip fudge?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, dig deep. Come – you would not quit at mile twenty-five of a marathon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Why don’t we take a break and you and I do dishes?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Don’t even think about it. Gram and I have it covered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You are not letting them do dishes after they just cooked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They want to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re seriously milking this whole ‘I’ve been missing for two months’ thing, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They are glad to have me back. And if fussing over me makes them happy – - enjoy it. Like you ought to be enjoying this potato chip fudge ice cream sundae. It’s got that whole salty/sweet thing going on. It’s just – just like me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll – get – yeah, I’ll get it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett’s phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I know that you’ve only been back for a few weeks and we’re all still trying to process it, but, I’ve gotta say, Alexis waiting on you hand and foot – it’s just a little odd.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what’s really odd? An ice cream truck in the middle of nowhere? There’s no kids lining up to buy Bomb Pops around here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, this couldn’t have been the driver’s route.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Not even close. I just got off the phone with the owner of the ice cream truck, Sergei Vetochkin. The victim’s his son, Anton, 22. They found him behind the wheel around 5PM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is nothing sacred? I mean, who kills an ice cream man, a symbol of childhood innocence?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe someone wanted his money.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Except that today’s cash receipts were still in the van.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: And whoever did this shot him at close range. Two GSWs to the chest with powder burns.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We figure the shooter boarded the truck and shot Anton, knocking him back into the shifter. It went into first and that’s why the truck rolled here. The killer probably bolted out the back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyone see it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ve got unis canvassing for witnesses but it’s not exactly an area where people hang out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about street cams?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Coverage is spotty. We’ll get really lucky if we get a hit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was this kid doing here in the first place?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI VETOTCHKIN
utterance.content: I don’t know why our son would be in that neighborhood. That’s – that’s not where we do business.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, is it possible that he was involved in something that would take him down there? Something dangerous?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: No. Anton was a good boy. Never got in trouble.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were there any troubles on his route? Anything unusual going on in his life?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What school did he go to?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: Since he was a boy in Abkhazia he loved to draw.

utterance.speaker: NATALIE BARNS
utterance.content: Yeah, there was definitely something wrong. I’d never seen Anton like that before.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Could you tell us what happened?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’d given the class an assignment and Anton was working at his station like everyone else and all of a sudden he started shaking like he was terrified.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because of what?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: I don’t know. Well, he ran out of the room, but I saw him later in the parking lot getting into a car with some guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What guy? Can you describe him?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: No, it was too dark. But I – I do remember the car. It was bright green. An old Camry.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you happen to get a license plate?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: I – I got a 3, an E, and a K.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You said this all started when he was at his station. Can we take a look at what he was working on?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Um, yeah. I have to log you into the system.

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: What the – his portfolio is gone and all of his projects have been deleted.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did Anton delete them? Why would he do that?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s CSU. Ryan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. CSU got us a lead. See how this cabinet door is open. Just like in these crime scene photos?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. So?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So when the cabinet door is closed –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s blood spatter on the door panel behind it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means the door was closed when Anton was shot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep. Now, see – – this smear of blood on the inside edge of the door? CSU said that this came from a finger, so somebody grabbed the door from the inside, pulling it open.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If someone was in there when Anton was shot –

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: They saw our killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A witness.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, not only that. I think our witness might be a kid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They left that on the inside of the cabinet. It’s a permission slip for a class trip. No usable prints on it, but it does have today’s date.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kennedy Elementary. It’s less than a mile away. Assuming an afternoon dismissal, Anton was shot at 5PM –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone from that school was in this van when Anton was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone from Mrs. Ruiz’s second grade class.

utterance.speaker: PRINCIPAL SILVA
utterance.content: I can’t imagine it’s one of Mrs. Ruiz’s students. Why would they even be in that area alone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we’ll know more once our youth officer’s done talking to them. Now, what time did Mrs. Ruiz’s class let out yesterday?

utterance.speaker: PRINCIPAL SILVA
utterance.content: At 3PM. And each child was picked up by a parent or authorized guardian.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. And I’m going to need a list of all of their names so we can determine where they were at 5PM.

utterance.speaker: PRINCIPAL SILVA
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE MIRANDA DANIELS
utterance.content: Detective Beckett? Mrs. Ruiz and I talked to all the students. None of them seems to be your witness.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except one of them has to be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, maybe we should talk to them again.

utterance.speaker: DANIELS
utterance.content: If they’re afraid to come forward that’s not going to help.

utterance.speaker: PRINCIPAL SILVA
utterance.content: Or perhaps they didn’t see anything. Either way these children shouldn’t be subjected to endless questions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I understand, but we have to find this witness.

utterance.speaker: DANIELS
utterance.content: In cases like this, a child is often more likely to open up to somebody who’s not an authority figure: a classmate, a friend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So … basically we’re looking for someone who won’t intimidate them. An adult presence, in the classroom, that eight year olds will view as a peer. Someone that they can consider one of their own?

utterance.speaker: PRINCIPAL SILVA
utterance.content: Okay, but where would we find someone like that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Got it. Easy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Mrs. Ruiz, for letting Castle spend time in your classroom.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, then we apologize for the imposition, but we do need to figure out who this witness is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but being 90% kid myself I have an ability to get into the minds of children. And I have the perfect plan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I appreciate your concern, Leslie – may I call you Leslie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excellent. I’m sure I’m more than capable of handling anything these little charmers can throw my way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In this case, an eraser.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, what do you got?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We chased down that partial plate that Anton’s teacher gave us. That car she saw? It looks like it’s registered to a retired cop, Clark Jaffe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A cop?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Anton placed a call to him that night from the payphone outside the college.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Bring him in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s going to be a problem. Jaffe’s dead. Shot to death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was shot, too? When?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yesterday. About eight hours before Anton. And I ran ballistics. It’s a match. It’s the same shooter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’m on my way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, everybody! Attention, everyone. Attention. Hey – guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Neat trick.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Good morning, class! Does anyone here know what a writer is? Yes.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: A writer writes stories.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s exactly right. And who here knows a writer?

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: This is boring! Mrs. Ruiz said I can show and tell my instant camera.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, aren’t you a writer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well as a matter of fact, I am.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Are you famous?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know if I’d use the word famous. Some people –

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: My dad says your books suck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He started it!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, I have a plan. Aside from me, does anyone here know another writer? Tell you what. Everyone look to your left. You’re looking at a writer. Except for you guys on the end, you’re looking at a wall. We are all writers. If you can tell a story, you can write a story. So … let’s do that right now. Let’s write a story. It can be about a little boy or a little girl, just like you. It can be as silly or as scary as you want it to be.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Can I write about having a tea party?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course you can.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIE
utterance.content: Mr. Castle? Is it okay to make some things up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course, yes. You can make things up. Or you could, um, you could write it based on something that happened in real life. Is everyone ready? And go!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found a link between our two vics?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Other than Anton getting into Jaffe’s car that night? Not so far. And Anton’s never been in trouble with the law.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You talk to Anton’s parents?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, they’ve never heard of Jaffe. I’m telling you, these guys, they lived in different neighborhoods. They moved in different circles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They drive off together and then the next day they both end up dead? They’re connected. We’ve just got to find out how.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ve got something else. After Clark Jaffe was killed someone tossed his place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The killer was looking for something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. That’s very kind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was – I just – you don’t like me very much, do you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t. Not directly. But an experience that powerful is going to find a way to express itself and end up on the page. Even the wildest fantasies are based on a kernel of truth. As a master storyteller, I’m able to separate the make believe from the telltale details of thinly veiled fact. You mark my words, Mrs. Ruiz. Somewhere in this pile is the key to identifying our witness.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I followed up on Jaffe’s car. There’s no GPS, no EZ-pass, there’s no way of finding out where he and Anton went that night. Okay, what about you on financials?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: For an ex-cop, the guy lived like a monk. So did Anton, which is part of our problem. The kid had no cell phone, no credit cards to pull. There’s gotta be a connection between these two guys. I’m just not finding it. But here’s what I don’t get. What’s a 22 year old ice cream man doing with an ex-cop anyway?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I may have a lead on that. I was looking into the ice cream truck. It was ticketed last week up on Marble Hill, which is nowhere near Anton’s route.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So…?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So I checked in to Clark Jaffe’s financials. Jaffe’s credit card shows that he parked at a meter the exact same block on the same day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This is traffic cam footage of Anton’s truck that day. Now watch.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He goes into that shipping store. What’s he doing in there?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I have no idea. But I scrubbed all the footage. This is from an hour earlier.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A green Camry. And that’s Clark Jaffe.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Going into the same store.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what were the two of them doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I found it! I think I found our witness. Right here. It’s Jack. He wrote a story about an evil giant, which, from a child’s perspective, is how the killer would seem. He said that the giant spoke in a loud, angry voice, said mean things, and promised he would hurt someone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but in this story the giant had a gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Keep moving! Move up! Cover me!

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Got him!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice work! Wait a minute … … I think I see more bad guys ahead. Uh oh.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a giant. And does he? Yeah, he does. He’s got a gun.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Oh no, get down. He’s going to shoot it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think?

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: He did last time. He said, “I’m gonna shoot.” Then he did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Last time, like in your story?

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Yes. He shot his gun. Bang, bang! And then the other guy was bleeding.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only, it wasn’t a story, was it, Jack? It really happened.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: I was scared. I closed my eyes until the giant disappeared.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, man. You were very brave.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: That’s not what my brother said.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your brother was there?

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: He said, “Don’t be a chicken, it’s just a movie.” Then he changed the channel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The giant was on TV?

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: Mr. Castle wet his pants! Mr. Castle wet his pants!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. No, no. It’s just – the ground was wet.

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: Yeah, Anton and Mr. Jaffe. They come in here a lot. Uh, Anton rented a PO box here about six months ago. Box 552. And he shared it with Jaffe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They were sharing a PO box?

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of mail were they getting?

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: That’s the thing. They weren’t getting any mail. At least, not that I ever saw.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then why did they need the box?

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: All I know is they both came in twice a week to check it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Together?

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: No. Usually about an hour apart.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They were using it as a dead drop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but for what? When was the last time you saw them?

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: I saw them both last week. But Anton came in yesterday. And he seemed a little worked up after I told him about the phone call I got.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What phone call?

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: Some dude with a Russian accent called and asked me who owned box 552. Anton’s box. I told the caller we don’t give out that kind of information. But when I mentioned the call to Anton, he flipped out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Anton knew this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: I guess so, because he went in to total panic mode. Said he had to use the phone. But I couldn’t let him use it. It’s against company policy, so he just raced out of here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What time was that?

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: Three o’clock.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 3PM? That’s two hours before Anton was killed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sounds like this Russian dude was coming for him. Who do you think Anton was trying to call? Jaffe?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or someone else connected to all of this. Look, Anton didn’t have a cell. So if he really needed to make a call, he’d go nearby.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll canvass all the stores near here, see if anyone let Anton use their phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. And school’s almost out. I’ll get ahold of Castle and see if he’s gotten any closer to finding our witness.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, no breakthroughs yet, but the good news is um … it looks like they’ve accepted me as one of their own. Okay guys, give me the wallet. That was a gift. Ow. Right in my –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, what is going on over there? Is there a problem?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, everything’s fine. I’ll talk to you tonight. Okay, ‘bye ‘bye. Okay guys, very funny. Give me back the wallet now. Mrs. Ruiz, a little help here? No?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Mr. Castle? Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yes, I am. I’m fine. Thank you, Emily. Very kind.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: I know how it feels. Sometimes bad things happen to me, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They do?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Uh huh. Really bad things. Things I didn’t want to tell Mrs. Ruiz when she asked me this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, things like what?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Like yesterday, I was –

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Will you be here tomorrow?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can count on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Esposito confirmed with Emily’s parents that her 14 year old brother was supposed to be watching her that day, but he was playing video games and he didn’t check on her for hours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So she could have sneaked out. It is her, Beckett. I knew it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is why we should have talked to her at her place last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And risk intimidating her? No, no, this girl – she’s ready to open up to me. We have … a special connection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Should I be worried?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only that I’m going to solve the case before you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Where do you think you’re going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … second grade?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Not without finishing your breakfast.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I ate most of it and I just – I’m late.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Come on, Dad. Just one more bite.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis, I do not have time –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Now, don’t forget your lunch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, you’re right. It’s weird. I’ll talk to her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But right now, I’m late for a tea party.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you so much. Oh, that’s plenty. Did you make this tea yourself?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have to say, it’s excellent.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, thank you.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Do you want some sugar?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, I’m trying to cut back. Do you have any low calorie fairy dust?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perfect. Mmm… delicious, thank you very much. And thank you for spending recess with me.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: You’re welcome. Do you want to build an ice palace?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s only my favorite thing to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here we go. That’s nice. You know, Emily … do you remember yesterday? You said that something really bad happened. Something –

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: You’re making the wall too high.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Sorry. Is that better? You said it was something that you didn’t want to tell Mrs. Ruiz about. Do you think maybe you’d want to tell me? Okay. You know, you could, if you wanted. It would just be one princess to another.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Because princesses help each other?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because princesses help each other.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: It’s about Jason.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jason … the kid who makes faces Jason?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: He’s a bully. He says mean things and pulls my hair. This morning, he stepped on my foot. On purpose.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Emily, do you know why people do mean things? Because it makes them feel strong. Really though, you and me? We’re the strong ones. We just keep our strength inside. So sometimes we forget it’s there.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Like sometimes I forget I have gum in my pocket.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. So, next time Jason does something mean, you just use that strength and just let it go. When he sees he can’t upset you, he’ll stop bothering you. Okay?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Can I go out and play now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. I’ll take care of these dishes and finish the palace.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Go ahead. Gloat. Maybe this was a dumb idea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I guess I am, aren’t I?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you … … Leslie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: She punched me in the nose!

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: It was my inside strength. I let it go, like Mr. Castle said.

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: You told her to hit me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? No, Jason –

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: I’m going to tell the principal!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – that was –

utterance.speaker: PRINCIPAL SILVA
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, I’m sure that this is being blown out of proportion. But I’ll be candid. Jason’s parents are two high powered lawyers with a zest for litigation. We found out a while ago that it’s best not to upset them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what are you saying?

utterance.speaker: PRINCIPAL SILVA
utterance.content: We gave this experiment a fair shot. But now we have to move on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Principal Silva, please. It – I just need a little more time.

utterance.speaker: PRINCIPAL SILVA
utterance.content: I wish that I could believe that, Mr. Castle, but have you made any progress in identifying this supposed witness? Any progress at all?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nothing pops with these financials. If Anton and Jaffe were doing anything illegal with that PO box, they weren’t making much money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Clark Jaffe put in thirty years, he retired with commendations and a spotless service record. Why would someone like him break the law?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m asking the same thing about Anton. What we really need is Castle’s witness.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Canvass got a hit. The owner of a bodega near that mailbox store said that Anton came in all desperate to use the phone. The guy let him make a call.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To whom?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: To this guy. Dmitri Kalenkov. He emigrated to the US in ’03 and is rumored to be an enforcer for the Bratva.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Russian organized crime?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait a minute. The guy who called asking about the PO box, wasn’t he Russian, too? What if that was Dmitri and he’s the one that took out Jaffe and Anton?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe they were involved in something illegal and whatever it was stepped on Russian mob turf.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Anton called Dmitri to smooth things over.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And ended up taking two in the chest.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks, LT. Organized crime just got a current address on Dmitri.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dmitri Kalenkov!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hands up, hands up!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hands up, Dmitri!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, that smells good.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Found him. It’s Dmitri.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s been shot. Been dead at least a couple of days.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett? Check it out. Electrical cable? Car battery? Leads?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was tortured first.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, someone might have been tortured here, but it was Dmitri.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The only injury I see besides bullet wounds is a blunt force trauma to the back of the head, and by the look of the contusion I would say it was made by that broken chair arm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So if Dmitri wasn’t tortured, maybe he was the one doing the torturing. It fits the profile of a mob enforcer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means whoever was tied into that chair broke free, overpowered Dmitri, and then shot him. How long has he been dead?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’d say at least three days.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Dmitri was killed before Jaffe and Anton.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And most likely by the same shooter. Same two taps to the chest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, thanks, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why kill a mob enforcer, an ice cream man, and a retired cop? What were they mixed up in?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know, but it’s starting to look like a Russian thing with Anton, Dmitri, the guy who called the mailbox store.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, touch base with organized crime again. Let’s see if there’s a conflict in the Russian community.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. That was Anton’s parents. Someone just broke into their apartment and tossed the place.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just like Jaffe’s place was tossed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The killer’s after something. Something that our victims had.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye! Bye, sweetheart. ‘Bye Fiona. ‘Bye June. ‘Bye Sophie. ‘Bye Sarah. ‘Bye. Have a good one, buddy. Jack, you make sure you keep your guard up on that battlefield, all right? All right. ‘Bye sweetheart.

utterance.speaker: GIRL
utterance.content: ‘Bye.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: You’re leaving?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, Emily, I’ve gotta go.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Is it because I got you in trouble?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no. No, Emily, that’s not your fault. I’m always in trouble. Come here. You make sure you use your princess powers for good, okay?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: ‘Bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘Bye, guys!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you very much, Mrs. Ruiz.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I appreciate that.

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: I could not believe what I saw. When my wife and I got back from lunch the door was kicked in and the place was torn apart.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you have any idea what they were looking for?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: In Anton’s room the ceiling vent was pried open and on the floor, right below it, I found this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Passports?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They’re blank.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was Anton doing with these?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: I’ve never seen them before today. What was my son involved in?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He was studying graphic design. Do you think he was forging passports?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Vetotchkin, I need to ask you. Do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: Yes, that’s Dmitri. Dmitri Kalenkov.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how do you know him?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: He and my son grew up together, back in Abkhazia, before the war. Was Dmitri involved in this, too?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Just one moment. Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, you need to come down here. I found something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, whoever put this in your pocket –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is sending me a message. Our witness is reluctant to come forward, but when they saw I was leaving it forced their hand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have you tried just asking who drew it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t want to scare them off. But I have a plan.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: I’m Emily. Who are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m Kate. I’m Mr. Castle’s … friend.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Do you like to play princess with him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … … sometimes.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Are you two getting married?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: One day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: One day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so what are we looking for?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A drawing that looks like it could have been made by the same kid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, these are second graders. I mean, don’t their drawings look the same?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I imagine they won’t need much prompting when we confront them. This has clearly been eating away at their delicate little psyches. Given the chance to unburden themselves –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Who is our sensitive little soul?

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: Hey! Mrs. Ruiz! Why are you going through my desk?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jason? You’re the witness?

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: I’m not talking to Mr. Castle. He’s a jerkface.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, you know what? He’s the jerkface.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s eight years old. You’ve been here for a day and a half and you already have a nemesis?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How was I supposed to know he’d be the witness?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jason, honey, I want you to know that you’re not in trouble, okay?

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: Duh. All I did was draw a picture.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly. But I know that you want to tell me all about this picture. Except jerkface over there – – he thinks you’re scared and that we should call your mom to come pick you up.

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: I’m not scared!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Told ya. So listen, I need you to tell me everything that you remember seeing while you were hiding in this ice cream truck.

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: I – I can’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jason, believe me. It’s going to feel a lot better letting it out rather than keeping it in.

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: No. I can’t because I wasn’t there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You weren’t?

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: But I know who was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: I’m not supposed to tell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jason, listen. We just want to help you. Okay?

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: It was my sister.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Does she go to this school, too?

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: She’s a grown up. We have different dads. I stay with her when our mom goes out of town.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you gave her your permission slip that day.

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: She dropped me off, then she said she had to meet her friend, the ice cream man. When she came home she was crying. She told me never to tell anyone where she went or something bad would happen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s your sister’s name?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Natalie Barnes!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re going to need you to come with us.

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: I was never in Anton’s truck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know that you were, Natalie. Listen, whatever you are scared of, I will protect you. But you have to tell me the truth. And you have to start with those passports that you helped Anton forge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you were involved.

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: We were just trying to do something good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who do you mean by ‘we’? You, Anton, and Jaffe?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tell me about the passports.

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Anton’s route covered Brighton Beach. And there were a lot of Russians there. And he’d seen so many of them come here with the promise of a job and then their papers would be taken and they’d be forced to work in sweatshops or – or worse and Anton was trying to get them back home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which they couldn’t do, not without the right documents.

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how did Jaffe fit in to all of this?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Well, Anton heard that Jaffe had a connection that could get blank passports, and Jaffe worked Brighton Beach as a cop, so he knew what was going on and – and he was sympathetic to the immigrants.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you were the one with the high-tech design software. That’s why Anton took your class.

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: When I found out what Anton was doing I – I decided to help because I …. I wanted to make a difference.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t understand how this got anyone killed.

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: The other night Anton was making a passport in class and he saw the photo of the client. And he recognized the man, it was this – this terrible man from his past.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Anton called him Polkovnik. Anton was terrified of him. He said that this Polkovnik once tried to kill him. But Anton said that he had to – to show the picture to a friend of his, just to be sure. Some guy called Dmitri.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Natalie, what did you see in that van?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Anton had left a message for me to meet him in his ice cream truck. Away from his usual route. And when I got there he said that Jaffe was dead. And that this man had killed him and that he was afraid that we would be next if we didn’t run. Well then, Anton saw him coming so he told me to hide. And I watched. I watched as Polkovnik gunned Anton down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You see his face?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you describe him?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Yeah, I can do better.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait, are you saying she’s got a picture of Polkovnik?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, in an envelope at her apartment, along with other information on him. Why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Because we looked into this guy, Polkovnik.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Suffice to say, he’s wanted for more than just three murders.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here in New York?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, in the Abkhazian region of Georgia ten years ago. He’s wanted by the World Court for war crimes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He was a militia leader. Committed atrocities, wiped out villages, including where Anton and Dmitri lived. That’s why they fled. Interpol’s been after this guy ever since.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They got a tip Polkovnik was in New York so they’re tightening the net. Only one problem – there’s no pictures of this guy, so no one knows what he looks like.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And he wants to keep it this way, so when Dmitri tried to take justice into his own hands Polkovnik killed him. Then he tracked down Jaffe and Anton and killed them, too. He knew that they could ID him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s what he was looking for, the picture that Anton was going to use on his passport.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A passport that he desperately needs to get out of this country.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, that photo’s at Natalie’s place. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s been here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Natalie said it was in the bedroom dresser, bottom right drawer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not here. He must have found it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not in the drawer, Natalie.

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: The photo was in an envelope. I hid it in an old camera case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. Jason said he stayed here because his mom was out of town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Natalie, the – the camera case that you put the envelope in, was it for a Polaroid camera?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: How’d you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because Jason brought it to Kennedy Elementary yesterday for show and tell. That photo is in Mrs. Ruiz’s classroom right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We get that photo, we’ll get Polkovnik. Come on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The FBI’s been notified. They have agents on the way and their tactical units are sweeping the area around Natalie’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are we on the APB?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ready to go. And the Feds want to get this on the evening news. All they need is that photo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yep. They’ll have it in five.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, which one’s Jason’s desk?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Behind you!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I’ve taken worse. In this classroom, as a matter of fact.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cupcake stampede! Come and get them, guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There you go. One for everyone. Help yourselves. This is just a little thank you to say what a wonderful time I had with all for you. There you go. You’re welcome. I’m going to miss every one of you.

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: Even me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes Jason, even you. What do you say? Truce?

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: Yeah, truce.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It looks like your nemesis isn’t ready to call it a truce just yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Especially not when he sees what I put on his back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Leslie? One for you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, we have something else for you as well. This is a medal of outstanding service from the NYPD for your invaluable help with tracking down our witness.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s agreed to testify. And with her help, our three victims, along with many, many other people, will finally get justice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you kidding? You put up with Castle for two whole days.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No faces. That’s right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: JASON
utterance.content: See you later.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Later, J. That’s me …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s Alexis texting me. “Be sure you come home right after school.” How’d she even know I was here right now? She put one of those tracker apps on my phone!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, Castle … this is getting a little out of hand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I’m going to have to deal with this. And I think I know how.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, what took you so long? School ended hours ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis, sweetheart –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m been really worried.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I know. And I think I know why. Because I disappeared. But I’m back now and I’m not going anywhere. I’m here to stay.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I just keep thinking I’ll lose you again or something terrible will happen. I know it sounds crazy –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, it does not sound crazy. I would feel the same way. Matter of fact, I did.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: After Paris.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After Paris. I couldn’t let you out of my sight. But I know that you consider yourself the adult of the family –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: For good reason.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For very good reason. But … but part of being an adult is realizing you can’t always protect the people you love.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Being an adult really sucks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. And you’ve spent way too much time having to be one. So …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m ordering you to be a kid.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Don’t you think I’m a little old for that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am not too old for it, so you are definitely not too old for it. Don’t you think we should at least test them out?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where do you want to go?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I don’t know. Ice cream?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How about pizza? After this case I might be off ice cream for a while.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
